comparisons.answer1: If XCl ₂ is the chloride, then metal X has valency 2. Therefore: -  Sulphate formula: XSO ₄ -  Hydroxide formula: X(OH) ₂
comparisons.answer2: If XCl2 then X should be a metal with valency 2 Therefore - (1) Sulphate formula: XSO4 - (2) Hydroxide formula: X(OH)2

comparisons.answer1: If XN is the nitride, metal X has valency 3 (since nitrogen has valency 3). Therefore: i) Sulphate formula: X ₂ (SO ₄ ) ₃ ii) Hydroxide formula: X(OH) ₃ - i)
comparisons.answer2: XN is nitride. X is a valency 3 metal as nitrogen has valency 3 Therefore Sulphate's formula would be x2(SO4)3 and Hydroxide formula would be x(OH)3

comparisons.answer1: Valency of nitrogen in: i) NO: +2 ii) N ₂ O: +1 iii) NO ₂ : +4 Additional Questions
comparisons.answer2: valency of Nitrogen in: - 1) NO : +2 2) NO2 : +1 3) NO2 : +4

comparisons.answer1: Eight metals showing variable valency: - 1. Iron (Fe): +2, +3 - 2. Copper (Cu): +1, +2 - 3. Mercury (Hg): +1, +2 - 4. Tin (Sn): +2, +4 - 5. Lead (Pb): +2, +4 - 6. Gold (Au): +1, +3 - 7. Chromium (Cr): +2, +3, +6 - 8. Manganese (Mn): +2, +3, +4, +6, +7 Valency of sulphur in: a) SO ₂ : +4 b) SO ₃ : +6

Examples of chemical equations: a) One product: 2H ₂ + O ₂ → 2H ₂ O b) Two products: CaCO ₃ → CaO + CO ₂ c) Three products: 4HNO ₃ → 2H ₂ O + 4NO ₂ + O ₂ d) Four products: 2KClO ₃ → 2KCl + 2O ₂ + O ₂ + Heat
comparisons.answer2: Examples of Chemical Equations: ## Page 2 (a) One product : $2 H \_{2}+ O \_{2} \rightarrow 2 H \_{2} O $ (b) Two Products : $ CaCO \_{3} \rightarrow CaO + CO \_{2}+ \_\_\_\_$ - (c) Three Products : $4 HN O\_{3} \rightarrow 2 H \_{2} (c) Three Products : $4 HN O\_{3} \rightarrow 2 H \_{2} O +4 NO \_{2}+ O \_{2}$ (d) Four Products : $2 KClO \_{3} \rightarrow 2 KCl +2 O \_{2}+ O \_{2}+\_\_$ Answer 2-D)
